706298f-a.text:
Plumb 1st Street (foreground) south of Voorhies Ave., looking southeast, showing Gerritsen Beach at left. On the right is a foot bridge,
which connects Plumb Island with Sheepshead Bay.
July 4, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
706298f-a.folder: Plumb 1st Street & Voorhies Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

707231f-a.text:
Voorhies Ave., east from Plumb 1st Street to Shell Bank Creek where it terminates. In the background are the Gerritsen Beach homes. At the left is Plumb 1st Street.
July 7, 1935.
P.L. Sperr.
707231f-a.folder: Voorhies Ave. & Plumb 1st St., Brooklyn, NY

707230f-a.text:
Voorhies Ave. at the N.E. corner of Plumb 1st Street, as seen from Shell Bank Creek, showing "Roeders Corals", which is a dining, drinking
and dancing establishment.
June 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
707230f-a.folder: Voorhies Ave. & Plumb 1st St., Brooklyn, NY
